intro: Gymnocalycium hyptiacanthum subsp. schroederianum, commonly known as the Schröder's moon cactus, is a species of cactus native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its globular to cylindrical stem, which is typically covered in white to yellow spines. The plant produces showy, yellow or orange flowers during the warmer months. It is a succulent that stores water in its thick, fleshy stems, allowing it to survive in arid environments. This subspecies is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its unique appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
